pageContext.description: Edge sharp, but it has obviously been interfered with since finding (patina destroyed). No ornamentation.
pageContext.surface: Smooth, except where patina is chipped off at cutting edge.
pageContext.associations: Finds of stone celts, [querns?] & were prolific at this site. A palstave - Barrow Museum U.S. - was found with this implement.
pageContext.publications: North Lansdale Mag., 1896, Vol. I, p. 91 (il.),Cumb. [...] A.T.A. Soc. Trans. N.S., XII, p. 281.
pageContext.site: England,Lancashire (Furness),Stainton-in-Furness,Stainton Quarries,Found during quarrying operations in 1`894, when ancient settlement - "Stone Close" was being demolished. It was never excavated or even archaeologically examined.
